comments.body: is this equivalent to `[dict(d) for d in data]` ? :s

yes, but it looks like it avoids instantiating new dicts if they are already dicts. Cython methods usually have rigid typechecks, which is probably the reason for the `is` comparison. (see `lib.dicts_to_array` below)
wow, surprised it's so expensive to call dict on a dict (you're right this is significantly faster).
